Package edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.interpreter

The Interpreter package provides support for transformational interpretation of a source programming language.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ICorrelateSource
    ICorrelateSource correlates a span in transformed code, given by beginning and ending line and column number, to an approximate span in the original source code.
    IDispatcher
    Dispatcher that chooses the delegate, i.e., another interpreter, to which to hand statements for execution.
    IEnvironment
    Interface for accessing environment variables.
    IInterpreter
    Interface for transformational interpreters that parse, transform, and then execute statements on a scripting substrate.
    IInterpreterContext
    Context for a transformational interpreter, such as parent, dispatch children, and other subordinate classes set by dependency injection.
    IInterpreterSetters
    Setters for dependency injection of properties into a transformational interpreter.
    IPropertiesExtender
    IPropertiesExtender extends Properties with setters for changeable delegation of its defaultProperties, as well as load() and store() methods that operate on strings.
    IScriptEval
    Evaluates scripts and sets bindings for the environment.
    ISubstrate
    Interface for the underlying substrate that executes scripts.
    ITransformInterpreter
    Interface for setting transforms for default transformational interpreter.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractShell
    Base implementation of a transformational multi-interpreter used by both the command shell, or meta-interpreter, and sub-interpreters for specific languages.
    AbstractSubstrate
    Base class for the underlying substrate that executes scripts.
    CommandShell
    CommandShell is an outer interpretive shell implemented using a transformational meta-interpreter.
    CorrelateSource
    CorrelateSource correlates a span in transformed code, given by beginning and ending line and column number, to an approximate span in the original source code.
    Environment
    Provides thread-safe methods to set and get environment variables.
    LanguageContext
    Provides state for the language declared in a script directive.
    PropertiesExtender
    PropertiesExtender extends Properties with setters for changeagble delegation of defaultProperties, as well as load() and store() methods that operate on strings.
    TransformInterpreter
    TransformInterpreter implements a base transformational interpreter that performs multi-stage transforms on its input and then executes the result on a script engine substrate.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ExecuteException
    ExecuteException contains errors or warnings from processing source statements in the interpreter or in the extension libraries.
    InterpreterException
    InterpreterException contains errors or warnings from running the the interpreter or its interpreter substrates.
    SubstrateException
    SubstrateException contains errors or warnings from executing transformed source statements on target interpreter substrates.

Package edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.interpreter Description

The Interpreter package provides support for transformational interpretation of a source programming language.

The interpreter is structured as a meta-interpreter, that is, an outer interpreter that identifies parse units and their specific target language, for example specified in a directive, and then passes them to the appropriate sub-interpreter to fully parse, normalize, filter, transform, and execute on a substrate such as Groovy.

All of the interpreters, both the outer command shell or meta-interpreter, and the sub-interpreters, follow the same design and implement the same interfaces: to parse, normalize, filter, transform, and then execute a line of input. A meta-interpreter has the added responsibility to identify parse units and their target language and dispatch the detected complete statements to the appropriate sub-interpreter.

This package contains the command shell used in the transformational interpreter, as well as the interfaces and default implementation for sub-interpreters.
